comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: This is a fantastic photograph taken from the first floor of the Ulster Reform Club in Royal Avenue - the buildings to the left and right are still there although the building in the centre, at the corner of Castle Place and Donegall Place, formerly known as 'Gibson's Corner', has been replaced by a modern McDonald's. As the tram system wasn’t electrified until late 1905 – the first test took place in Sep 1905 and the system was officially opened on 5 Dec 1905 – this photo is most likely post-1905.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gerryward] Thanks Gerry! Have amended date to "Circa 1906" and added "Gibson's Corner" as a tag...  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The Lennon Wylie site lists a Berlitz school in Belfast for the first time in 1907, at Royal Avenue, and has it moving to Wellington Place in 1910.

comment.author: 38401430@N06
comment._content: The building on the right edge of the shot is the Bank Builings which is now the spiritual home of Primark - given that it was their first store and now a place retail pilgrimage.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] So this has to be between 1907 and 1910 then? (Better 6 months late than never :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
